[h1]The border-radius Property[/h1]

With CSS3, you can give any element "rounded corners" by using the [b]border-radius[/b] property.

[b]The CSS:[/b][code format="css" codeId="580"][b]border-radius[/b]: 20px;
background-color: green;
color: white;[/code]
[b]Result:[/b] [img id="2666" width="100%"]
Specific border radius values can be applied for the border-radius property in the following order: [b]top-left[/b], [b]top-right[/b], [b]bottom-right[/b], [b]bottom-left[/b]. [code format="css" codeId="581"]border-radius: [b]0 0 20px 20px;[/b][/code]
[b]Result:[/b] [img id="2667" width="100%"]
[note]The value of border-radius can also be specified in [b]percentages[/b].[/note]

answers.text: equal to half of the height and the width
